place_description: Looking for a refreshing and delicious dining experience at a fun restaurant in Charlotte, NC? Look no further than The Co-Op Frosé & Eatery! Since 2012, we have been serving up 60 rotating frosé flavors, gourmet sandwiches and salads, and all the good vibes! Whether you're in the mood for a classic frosé or want to try one of our unique flavor creations, we have something to satisfy every palate. Our menu also features a variety of mouthwatering gourmet sandwiches and salads made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. Stop by for a meal that will leave you feeling satisfied and refreshed. We also offer catering options. Visit us today!

reviews_data.review_text: My first time having the Italian and it was fabulous!

Picked up a couple sandwiches to-go and they are so good! I tried the Italian and the Cubano and both were constructed perfectly and tasted delicious! Really unique decor (if you like pink, this is the spot for you) and nice swag too! I had an iced latte while waiting for my food and it was great as well. They also specialize in frose so I'll have to try one next visit. Great initial impression!
Frose flight refreshing. Sandwich (cowboy chicken) delectable. Outside seating luminous.

As a patron I just witnessed a driver getted treated rudely from a worker there who's doing his job by picking up a togo order and out comes this worker from the back yelling we just got the order! Wait after the front staff asked what the name was. The blk guy comes out from the back gets into the drivers faces about how they just the order the driver said I did too I l was just saying the name who I'm picking up. They go at it for a few min. With the driver leaving and the worker still running his mouth about the situation. As a customer that's disgusting and disturbing to see.
great Sandwich with perfect layers, my frose mixed was good as well
Not really sure why there are @hampton inn coffee sleeves at a non Hampton inn location as well as all the same tea packets you find at Hampton inn.
this is such a cute coffee shop! the coffee was good and the sandwich was amazing. it's so cute in here. great for a girl's day or just an aesthetic insta post.

Brianna with Offline - I got the cowboy chicken sandwich and it was really good. I did a few modifications to it such as swapping the kaiser roll for baguette bread and adding red onions. It was a good size to where it was feeling but I didn't feel stuffed.
Emma and Mo were great

The Cowboy Chicken was really good and I wish the sandwiches were marketed more than the froses.

The staff are funny and great but the food is way better than the Frozen options.
Great food, great atmosphere and super friendly staff!! It's a good vibe all around. Even the parking was easy!
The Italian is really,really good. I'll definitely try the others. Happy to have a good sandwich spot now.
Always a must when on IOP. Kevin is the best!

Paid over $10 and waited almost 45 minutes for 2 really disappointing iced coffees-- I'm not a coffee snob, but this is just another place in Charlotte that can't seem to figure out how to make, arguably, one of the easiest drinks in the world. The manager seemed nice, but it really doesn't make up for the time I wasted.
Fun environment, and delicious Frose!
Excelent service

Me and my daughters ate there for the 1st time the other day. I got the chicken salad, and they ordered the Tuna Salad, & California Turkey. Me and my daughter that ordered the Tuna & Chicken Salad ended up vomiting with diarrhea at the same time. I believe the meat was bad.

Emma (manager) and staff are super sweet and accommodating. First time I went in as a patron and not a content creator, they showed the same level of excellent customer service!

My favs froses are the blackberry lavender, strawberry OG and dragonberry. The three sammies I've had this far are the California Turkey, Avocado Toast and The Classic Egg. I honestly love em all. They were seasoned, flavorful and filling. My top choice would be that durn Classic Egg sammich Emma whipped up!
I had a really great experience! Love the atmosphere and the staff was very friendly. I got the italian sandwich and it was so good!
I went in with a few friends that were in town .The service was wonderful.The manager Emma and staffer Abby were very attentive.

One of the cleanest places to eat in Charlotte. I have a service animal that comes with me, I never get any dirty looks from the employees. I greatly appreciate that. Emma is hands down a very welcoming person, thoughtful and overall good at her job. Abby is very sweet and always smiling, Abby does a great job recommending items to try. Jordan is always a pleasure to talk to! I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a clean fresh sandwich and an icy cold Frose look no further than Co-Op in Charlotte Southend!!!

Went here for lunch one day and there was a huge dog chained behind the counter, under the FRose machines and in front of the door that leads to the kitchen.... Server was extremely nice but I thought that was odd and unsanitary. Especially when I'm paying $14 for a sandwich.
Love the co-op! One of my favorite places to grab a sandwich in south end! Cannot go wrong with any of the frose flavors!

I come here often and lately there has been no one out front and I have to wait a while. The last two times I've been eating and watched customers come in and end up leaving because no one is out front. I recommend a bell of some sort to let the staff in the back know that folks have come in. Otherwise, the food is wonderful!
Great sandwiches and a friendly staff! Will definitely be back!

Whoever decided to make the flavor chipotle pineapple and told everyone at the counter to say it tastes mostly like pineapple shouldn't be employed and whoever agreed and went with the decision to let chipotle pineapple be one of the selected flavors deserves to be right next to them. Wow and I mean wow, I've never tasted a drink so awful in my entire life. Looks like mud, tastes like what I would imagine to be mud. Everything is awful about it. Gives a bad name for pineapple, gives a bad name for chipotle. Worst of both worlds 0/10 do not recommend.
The best frose around!!
Neat vibe. Lovely motif and decor. The flavors are quite tart, but the dragon fruit hits; good portion too. Jack was very helpful and friendly, I will definitely be back! Fantastic music.
They are so friendly, cheap, coffee, and just a of all great atmosphere
The food is so good! I recently just got their breakfast burrito and Emma was so helpful. I've also been in and bri is so friendly! Pop on in the next time you are in South End!

This spot is super cute and very unique. The service was really good and the restaurant was very clean. However, I wasn't too crazy about the taste or flavors of the drinks. I couldn't taste the flavor that the drink was supposed to be.
Had the Cali turkey and it was delicious.  The red head lady at the cashier was amazing too!  Super helpful and happy to be there.  Will def come back.
Very friendly staff. Emma is a delight especially. They offer a variety of frozen rose flavors. Very innovative and gorgeous design.
The Co-Op is such a fun, vibrant space and the froses are delicious. I love this spot and the atmosphere within.
I stopped in while walking in the area. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the sandwich and chips also were very good. Delightful!
Very nice we gotten frozen frose it's a wine drink delicious 10 out of 10 I highly recommend customer service was top tier
I recently got a catering order and everything went super well! The variety of flavors was really nice, the service was quick, and the location is comfy! Next time I will hang out and grab some food!

The co-op is a super cute place to meet up with friends and grab a bite to eat! I tried the California Turkey sandwich and the OG Frose, both were delicious! The service was a little slow considering we went at a time where there weren't very many people, but the workers were all friendly and we got what we needed. I would definitely go back and try more frose flavors, they have so many options to choose from!
Sandwiches were pretty average and most cost $13 for just just the sandwich and it's tiny. Cool place but definitely overpriced even for South End
Love Love Love!  Great spot!

Cute and clean space with drinks (frozen rose) at a very reasonable price, especially for this area. Try the flight so you can try various flavors (they change), white peach might be my favorite, but you can't go wrong with the OG strawberry or strawberry lemonade). Customer service is also friendly and welcoming. Haven't tried the food. Definitely one of my go to spots for a nice, cold drink!

Side note: great pizza spot next door. Pizza by the slice.

The Co-op Frose & Eatery is a nice restaurant and concept.

1.  It is very clean and bright.  You just feel great walking into this place.  It's located in a strip mall  set up with Heist Brewery and a pizzaria.

2.  The Frose is good!  They have a bunch of flavors.  We tried White Peach and Strawberry Lemonade.  Both were really good.

3.  The food was not very good at all.  We tried the California Club and also the Cowboy Chicken.  The issue is... They both are flavorless and just a bit boring.  For about $12 each we would've expected them to be unique and full of flavor.  We ended up paying about $52 for 2 sandwiches and 2 Frose.  We left a bit unsatisfied.

4.  I still would suggest that you stop by for the atmosphere and the Frose.

Flight is the way to go the first time to try 4 different flavors. Strawberry lemonade and blackberry lavender were my favorite 2 that I tried. The raspberry tasted a little too strong. I was surprised that I could tell the frose had alcohol in it.. they weren't just frozen drinks, actually had a slight kick so felt like it was worth the price. The Italian sandwich was also pretty good. Would def come back to try other flavors and to see if they have any additional options once they get the espresso machine

Great concept and great use of space. We enjoyed the food and beverages. If I disliked dealing with people as much as our cashier I would hope another job where I didn't have to speak to others would come available soon. May stop by again if anyone else is serving.

Came in for the to-go frose that were featured on the pictures, but they weren't available. Settled with getting some sandwiches, but were disappointed to find out that any substitutions (bread change, onions instead of pickles) cost extra money. Ended up making the sandwiches at least $13 a piece. We would have been ok with that if they weren't the skimpiest sandwiches I've seen in my life. Don't waste your time unless you're in a rush. Just go to jersey mikes or firehouse sub.
This placeeee is so cute. The staff is amazing. Walking into the place is like a dream. Frose is TOP NOTCH. Best customer service i've had since moving to Charlotte. A++!!

Great fast casual spot with a variety of frose options. The pricing is very south end and expensive for some okay sandwiches but the drinks are where it's at. No to go alcohol so keep in mind you have to stay and imbibe. Highly suggest the Tuna Salad Sando and the California Turkey! Plus $1 drip coffee for those that just need a cup of Joe in the AM.
LOVE LOVE LOVE
Been twice since it opened. Love the product, loved the service and staff. Keep up the great work!!

The sandwiches my wife and I had were amazing.  I had the Cuban and my wife had the Cali Turkey.  She thought it was the best frose she had ever had...I am not a frose guy but I agreed to try it and WOW it was delicious.  I highly recommend the OG.  The staff was great as well (minor wait time because it was crazy busy).  Will be back ASAP and can't wait to try more frose flavors.

The perfect addition to South End. The frose is to die for, and the whole vibe makes you want to never leave. My teacher friends and I love having this spot to decompress after a long day. 10/10 recommend! We also love visiting their location in IOP!

Gluten free bread even?! I've been a fan since 2020, but this location in my town makes me so happy. Allergy friendly. Amazing staff! The GM from Kiawah Island was there helping over the weekend and was so great to interact with. What a vibe this place is!

We live in Mt. Pleasant and always go to the Sullivan's Island location. When we visit my daughter in Clt we always make an effort to fly by the Clt location. Aside from the frose we particularly enjoy their chicken sandwich, it's top notch.
This place is so much fun. The froses are delicious and the chicken sandwiches are amazing!

I love going down to Charleston to visit the Co-Op on Sullivans Island, so I was SO excited for this new location to open up in Charlotte! I work right across the street so it makes going to get a frose flight pretty easy :) I also love their sandwiches and was happy to have a new lunch spot in the area! Please go support this local business, you won't be disappointed.
Friendly people! Very reasonably priced, neat concept. Definitely recommend!
Love this place in every city they expand to!
Great service, delicious Frose! The Co-Op is my favorite spot at IOP and I am so happy to have one in Charlotte!

I'm SO happy a little piece of Charleston is in CLT! It isn't the same eating it in the middle of busy South End as opposed to taking my sammie and frose (in a yeti) on the beach but nonetheless stoked to have my fave sandwich (California turkey) close by. Cowboy chicken and veggie are super close seconds!
Great place! A lot of fun, great customer service, and the Frose is sooooo good. My wife and I love everything about this brand and product!! Def check it out if you're in the area

Amazing in all aspects.  Great location..great food (I had the Cali Turkey) and the frose was off the charts good.  So glad this Charleston staple opened in Charlotte.  Can't wait to see a game in Bank of America as well since they told us they have their frose in the stadium!!!

Amazing new spot for food but most especially for Frose! What a great concept with an amazingly nice staff! I took the OG but there was different flavors available for the day. This spot is dog friendly which is really nice

$1 drip coffee. Frose. And breakfast sandwiches. Need I say more? Alsi, it's not overpriced like 99% of the spots in CLT.

Excited for this new spot just in time for summer and the hot weather. Cheers!
